page.title: 02History of Featherstone
page.content: Many theories are held as to the origin of the name of the town which was first mentioned in the Doomsday survey of 1086 as Fredston.The most recent theory being that it comes from a compound of four and stan meaning 4 stones,depicting an ancient cromlech consisting of 3 uprights and a head- stone which at one time may have been situated there.The old mansion of Aketon Hall is of some historic interest having been the home of the Fetherston family during the Plantagent period.The date of the foundation of the Parish Church is unknown but the church is mentioned in The Domesday Book.This church was given Robert De Lacey to his newly founded Priory of Nostell until the Reformation,when it was given by Henry V111 to the Dean and Chapter of Christ Church Oxford,who are todays patrons.
